description: “This American Life,” in a partnership with The New York Times, tells the story of one family caught in the dangerous crossover of mental health treatment and security in American hospitals.
title: One Patient’s Story: ‘That’s a Kill Shot’
title_page: One Patient’s Story: ‘That’s a Kill Shot’ - The New York Times
text: Last August, Alan Pean, a 26-year-old college student with suspected bipolar disorder, was shot in an encounter with two off-duty police officers working as security guards at the Houston hospital where he had come for help. The near-fatal incident illuminates what can happen when mental illness, medicine and weapons — increasingly deployed by medical centers across the country — intersect. We’re telling the story in collaboration with WBEZ Chicago’s This American Life, so in addition to reading the article, you can hear Alan and his family reflect on his ordeal.
